refers: SENSE OF TASTE / THE TASTE OF SOMETHING

stems.BSC: (to be) the flavor of something and the act of tasting thereof [act of tasting + the flavor itself]; an act of tasting the flavor of something — [both the flavor and the sensing thereof]
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of tasting; to taste; to engage one’s gustatory sense
stems.OBJ: (to be) the entity/event/object whose flavor one tastes

stems: (to be) a taste bud [i.e., the gustatory organ]
(to be) one’s gustatory faculty; one’s sense of taste
notes:
The meaning of the old FORMAL stems previously associated with this root can be expressed by the following: for Stems 1 and 3, use appropriate Transrelative case marking for the arguments/participants; for Stem 2, use the MEC affix.

The GST affix can be used to create additional flavors and smells from any applicable formatives.

stems.BSC: (to be) something having a sweet flavor
stems.CTE: (to be/manifest) a particular sweet flavor (of something)
stems.OBJ: (to be) an entity having a sweet flavor [e.g., “the sweet-tasting one”]

notes: The GST affix can be used to create additional flavors and smells from any applicable formatives.
